**⏳ FLOWERING**
Delays the flowering of **long day plants**.

### **10. Ethylene: Basics**

**💨 NATURE**
The only hormone found in **gaseous form**.

**✅ PROOF**
Proven as a hormone by **Burg** (1962).

### **11. Ethylene: Functions**

**🍌 RIPENING**
Helps in the **ripening** of fruits.


**🌸 FLOWERS**
Increases the number of **female flowers**.

### **12. Ethylene: Separation & Artificial**

**🍂 ABSCISSION**
Motivates the separation of leaves, flowers, and fruits.

**🧪 ARTIFICIAL RIPENING**
Gas used for artificial ripening of fruit is **Ethane** or **Ethylene**.

### **13. Florigens**

**🌸 FLOWERING HORMONES**
Helps in **blooming** of flowers.

**📍 ORIGIN**
Formed in **leaves**.

### **14. Traumatin**

**🤕 HEALING HORMONE**
Formed in **injured cells**.
Helps heal the injury of plants.

**⚗️ CHEMICAL NATURE**
A type of **dicarboxylic acid**.

### **15. Chemical Composition**

**🧪 REGULATORS**
Plant growth regulators are small, simple molecules of diverse composition.

**🧬 TYPES**
Indole compounds, Adenine derivatives, Carotenoids, and Terpenes.

### **17. Growth Conditions**

**💧 HYDROPONICS**
Growth of plant **without soil**.


**🧂 SODIUM**
Not an essential component for plant growth.

### **18. Measuring Growth**

**📏 CRESCOGRAPH**
Device used to measure growth of plants.

**🇮🇳 INVENTOR**
Invented by **Jagadish Chandra Bose**.

Plant Diseases.content:
### **1. Viral Diseases: Tobacco**

**🍂 MOSAIC DISEASE**
Leaves get shrinked and become small.
Chlorophyll gets destroyed.

**🦠 PATHOGEN**
**Tobacco Mosaic Virus (TMV)**.
*(Note: Text states it is known as bacteriophage)*.


**🔥 CONTROL**
Affected plants should be burnt.

### **2. Viral Diseases: Banana & Okra**

**🍌 BUNCHY TOP OF BANANA**
Caused by **Banana virus**.
Plants become dwarf; leaves accumulate like a **rose** on the branch.

**🥬 YELLOW VEIN MOSAIC**
Affects **Bhendi (Okra)**.
Transmitted by **insects and white fly**.

### **3. Bacterial Diseases: Potato**

**🥔 WILT OF POTATO**
Also known as **Ring Disease**.
Brown ring is formed on the **xylem**.

**🦠 PATHOGEN**
*Pseudomonas solonacearum* bacteria.

**⚠️ EFFECT**
The **conduction system** of the plant is affected.

### **4. Bacterial Diseases: Cotton**

**☁️ BLACK ARM OF COTTON**
Caused by **Xanthomonas** Bacteria.

**🍂 SYMPTOMS**
Water-soaked **brown spots** formed on the leaves.

### **5. Bacterial Diseases: Rice**

**🌾 BACTERIAL BLIGHT**
Caused by **Xanthomonas oryzae** bacteria.

**🍂 SYMPTOMS**
Yellow-greenish spots seen on both sides of leaves.
**Vascular bundles** get blocked due to bacterial growth.

### **6. Bacterial Diseases: Citrus**

**🍋 CITRUS CANKER**
Caused by **Xanthomonas citri** bacteria.

**🌏 ORIGIN**
Originated in **China**.

**🍂 AFFECTS**
Leaves, branches, and fruits are all affected.

### **7. Bacterial & Nematode Disease**

**🌾 TUNDU DISEASE OF WHEAT**
Caused by **Corinobacterium titrici** bacteria and **Enzuina Titriki** Nematode.

**🍂 SYMPTOMS**
Lower parts of the leaves are faded and turned yellow.

### **8. Fungal Diseases**

**🌾 RUST OF WHEAT**
Caused by fungi **Puccinia**.


**🌱 DAMPING OFF**
Disease of seedlings caused by fungus **Pythium debaryanum**.

**🍬 RED ROT OF SUGARCANE**
Caused by fungus **Colletotrichum falcatum**.

### **9. Insect Diseases**

**🌾 SAHU DISEASE**
Disease of **wheat** caused by insect.

### **10. Deficiency Diseases: Zinc & Copper**

**🥭 LITTLE LEAF**
Mango and Brinjal: **Zinc (Zn)** deficiency.
Lemon: **Copper (Cu)** deficiency.

**🍋 DIEBACK**
Dieback of Lemon: **Copper (Cu)** deficiency.

**🌽 WHITE BUD**
Maize: **Zinc (Zn)** deficiency.

**🌾 KHAIRA DISEASE**
Paddy: **Zinc (Zn)** deficiency.

### **11. Deficiency Diseases: Others**

**🥔 BLACK HEART**
Potato: **Oxygen ($O_2$)** deficiency.

**🍈 MARSH DISEASE**
Pea: **Manganese (Mn)** deficiency.

**🍒 BURNING OF LEAF**
Litchi: **Potassium (K)** deficiency.

### **12. Deficiency Diseases: Rare**

**🥗 MICROSIS**
Amla: **Boron** deficiency.

**🥬 KOTER SPOT**
Turnip: **Calcium (Ca)** and **Molybdenum (Mo)** deficiency.

### **13. Botany Facts: Trees**

**🌳 LARGEST ANGIOSPERM TREE**
*Eucalyptus*.

**🌲 LONGEST TREE**
*Sequoia giganteum* (Coast Red Wood of California).
Height: **120 meters**.
Type: **Gymnosperm**.

### **14. Botany Facts: Small Plants**

**🌱 SMALLEST ANGIOSPERM**
*Lemna*.
Aquatic plant found in India.

**🌿 SMALLEST PTERIDOPHYTA**
*Azolla* (Aquatic plant).

**🌲 SMALLEST GYMNOSPERM**
*Zamia pygmea*.

### **15. Botany Facts: Leaves & Seeds**

**🍃 LARGEST LEAF**
*Victoria Regia*.
Aquatic plant found in West Bengal, India.


**🥥 LARGEST SEED**
*Lodoicea* (Double Coconut).
Found in Kerala, India.

**🌰 SMALLEST SEED**
*Orchid*.

### **16. Botany Facts: Flowers**

**🌸 SMALLEST FLOWER**
*Wolfia*.
Diameter: **0.1 millimeter**.

**🌺 LARGEST FLOWER**
*Rafflesia arnoldii*.
Diameter: **1 meter**.
Weight: **8 kilograms**.

### **17. Botany Facts: Parasites & Fossils**

**🐛 SMALLEST PARASITE**
*Arceuthobium*.
Angiosperm parasite on stems of gymnosperms.

**🦖 ALIVE FOSSIL**
*Cycas*.

**🌴 CYCAS FACTS**
Largest male couplet (gamete).
Largest seed-egg.

### **18. Botany Facts: Chromosomes**

**📉 SMALLEST CHROMOSOMES**
Found in **Algae**.

**📈 LONGEST CHROMOSOMES**
Found in **Trillium**.

**🔢 MAX CHROMOSOMES**
*Ophioglossum* (Fern).
Count: **1266** chromosomes.

**1️⃣ LEAST CHROMOSOMES**
*Heplapapopus gracilis* (Haplopappus).

### **19. Botany Facts: Wood**

**🪵 HEAVIEST WOOD**
*Hardwichia binata*.

**🪶 LIGHTEST WOOD**
*Ochroma lagopus* (Balsa).

### **20. Botany Facts: Special Plants**

**🍽️ CARNIVOROUS PLANTS**
Sundew, Venus flytrap, Pitcher plant.


**🎾 TENNIS BALL FRUIT**
*Kenth*.

**🔥 FIRE OF FOREST**
*Dhak*.

**🦠 SMALLEST CELL**
*Mycoplasma gallisepticum*.

### **21. Economic Botany: Beverages**

**☕ COFFEE**
*Coffea arabica*.
Contains **Caffeine**.

**🍫 COCOA**
*Theobroma cocoa*.
Contains **Theobromine** and **Caffeine**.

### **22. Economic Botany: Drugs**

**💊 MORPHINE**
Obtained from **Opium plant** (*Papaver somniferum*).
Extracted from **fruit coat (pod)**.

### **23. Economic Botany: Spices**

**🧂 CLOVE**
Obtained from **Bud of flower**.

**🍂 SAFFRON**
Obtained from **Stigma of flower**.

### **24. Nutrients & Manure**

**💩 GREEN MANURE**
Decomposing green legume.

**🔩 ZINC**
Micronutrient supplied by soil to plants.

**🛡️ PRIMARY NUTRIENTS**
Nitrogen, Phosphorus, and Potassium (NPK).

### **25. Recap: Bacterial Pathogens**

**🥔 POTATO**
*Pseudomonas solonacearum*

**☁️ COTTON**
*Xanthomonas* bacteria

**🌾 RICE**
*Xanthomonas oryzae*

### **26. Recap: Fungal Pathogens**

**🌾 WHEAT RUST**
*Puccinia*

**🍬 SUGARCANE RED ROT**
*Colletotrichum falcatum*

**🌱 SEEDLING DAMPING**
*Pythium debaryanum*

Ecology.content:
### **1. Introduction to Ecology**

**🌍 DEFINITION**
Study of inter-relationship between living organisms and their environment.

**🏞️ ENVIRONMENT**
Includes both **Biotic** (living) and **Abiotic** (non-living) factors.

**🏘️ BIOTIC COMMUNITY**
Various populations of living organisms in a definite geographical region.

### **2. The Ecosystem**

**📛 TERMINOLOGY**
The word 'Ecosystem' or 'Ecological system' was first coined by **Tansley**.

**🧩 COMPONENTS**
Every ecosystem is made up of two components:
1. **Biotic Component** (Living)
2. **Abiotic Component** (Non-living)

### **3. Biotic Components**

**🔢 DIVISIONS**
Divided into three main parts:
1. **Producer**
2. **Consumer**
3. **Decomposers**

### **4. Producers**

**🌱 DEFINITION**
Components that make their own food.

**🌿 EXAMPLE**
Green plants.

### **5. Consumers**

**🍽️ DEFINITION**
Components that consume the food made by plants.

**🔢 TYPES**
Consumers are of three types:
1. Primary
2. Secondary
3. Tertiary

### **6. Primary Consumers**

**🥗 HERBIVORES**
Organisms that live on **green plants** or some parts of them.

**🐇 EXAMPLES**
Implied: Goat, Cow, Deer (Animals that eat grass).

### **7. Secondary Consumers**

**🍖 CARNIVORES (Lower)**
Organisms that depend on the **primary consumers** as their food.

**🦊 EXAMPLES**
Fox, Wolf, Peacock, etc.

### **8. Tertiary Consumers**

**🦁 TOP CARNIVORES**
Organisms that depend on the **secondary consumers**.

**🐅 EXAMPLES**
Tiger, Lion, Cheetah, etc.

### **9. Decomposers**

**🍄 ROLE**
Decompose dead producers and consumers and change them into physical elements.

**🦠 EXAMPLES**
Mainly **Fungi** and **Bacteria**.

### **10. Abiotic Components**

**🪨 CATEGORIES**
1. Carbonic substance
2. Non-carbonic substance
3. Climatic factor

**☀️ EXAMPLES**
Water, sun-light, temperature, air, humidity, soil, minerals, etc.

### **11. Food Chain**

**🔗 DEFINITION**
Transfer of energy from the producer through a series of organisms.


**📝 EXAMPLE**
Grass ➝ Goat ➝ Human.

### **12. Food Chain Roles**

**🌾 GRASS**
Producer.

**🐐 GOAT**
Primary Consumer.

**🧍 HUMAN**
Primary as well as Secondary Consumer.

### **13. Global Ecology Facts**

**🌾 STEPPE**
Term associated with bio-region **grasslands**.

**🌧️ RAINFOREST**
About **2%** of the world's land area is Tropical Rainforest.

**🐮 DEFORESTATION**
**Beef** (growing appetite for food product) is the leading cause of tropical deforestation.

### **14. Resources & Diversity**

**🧬 BIOTIC RESOURCES**
Resources obtained by biosphere which have life.

**📊 B-DIVERSITY**
Also known as **Ecosystem Diversity**.

### **15. Conservation**

**🏞️ BIOSPHERE RESERVE**
An ecosystem with plants and animals protected by law.

**🎯 PURPOSE**
Conservation of natural resources, learning, and research for sustainable development.

### **16. Key Figures & Books**

**👨‍🔬 DR. DHRUBAJYOTI GHOSH**
Associated with ecology. Worked on the **East Kolkata Wetland** and its wise use.

**📕 RED DATA BOOK**
Deals with plants on the verge of **extinction**.

Nitrogen Cycle.content:
### **1. Nitrogen Fixation**

**🔄 DEFINITION**
Process in which **free atmospheric nitrogen** is converted into nitrogenous compounds.


**🦠 AGENTS**
Carried out by **living organisms**.

**🌱 PURPOSE**
To create compounds that can be used by plants.

### **2. Ammonification**

**⚗️ DEFINITION**
Formation of **Ammonia** from organic compounds.

**🥩 SOURCE**
Derived from **Proteins** and **Nucleic Acids**.

**🦠 AGENTS**
Carried out by micro-organisms.

### **3. Nitrification**

**🔄 PROCESS**
Ammonia is converted into **Nitrites** and **Nitrates**.

**🦠 BACTERIA**
Process is carried out by **Nitrobacter**.

### **4. Plant Consumption**

**🥗 PREFERRED FORM**
Plants use nitrogen mostly in the form of **Nitrate** ($NO_3^-$).

### **5. Denitrification**

**🔙 DEFINITION**
Process of converting fixed nitrogen (Nitrates, Nitrites, Ammonia) back into **free nitrogen**.


**🦠 BACTERIA**
Carried out by denitrifying bacteria like **Pseudomonas**.

Pollution.content:
### **1. Introduction to Pollution**

**🌫️ DEFINITION**
Unwanted changes in chemical/physical features of air, water, and land that are dangerous to life.

**🖐️ MAIN TYPES**
1. Air pollution
2. Water pollution
3. Sound pollution
4. Soil pollution
5. Nuclear pollution

### **2. Air Pollution Basics**

**☁️ DEFINITION**
When pollutants are present in the atmosphere and the quality of the atmosphere reduces.

**🏭 MAIN POLLUTANTS**
Carbon Monoxide (CO), Sulphur Dioxide ($SO_2$), Hydrogen Sulphide ($H_2S$), Nitrogen Oxides ($NO, NO_2$), Hydrocarbons, Ammonia, Tobacco smoke, Fluorides, Aerosols.

### **3. Specific Air Pollutants**

**🩸 CARBON MONOXIDE (CO)**
Combines with **hemoglobin** more rapidly than oxygen (causes suffocation).

**🏠 INDOOR POLLUTION**
The most important indoor air pollutant is **Radon gas**.

### **4. Acid Rain**

**⚗️ CHEMISTRY**
$SO_2, SO_3$, and $NO$ react with environmental water.

**🌧️ FORMATION**
They form **Sulphuric acid** and **Nitric acid**, reaching earth with rain water.

### **5. Bhopal Gas Tragedy**

**🗓️ DATE**
3rd December, 1984.

**☠️ GAS LEAKED**
Methyl Isocyanate (**MIC**).

**🏭 LOCATION**
Union Carbide Factory (Fertilizer maker), Bhopal.

### **6. Photochemical Smog**

**🏙️ LOCATION**
Formed in congested metropolitan cities.

**🧪 COMPOSITION**
Consists mainly of **Ozone**, **Peroxyacetyl nitrate (PAN)**, and **$NO_2$**.

### **7. Bio-Indicators & Nature**

**🌋 NATURAL POLLUTION**
Source: Volcanic eruptions.

**🍄 LICHEN**
The best indicator of **$SO_2$ pollution**.

### **8. Water Pollution Basics**

**💧 DEFINITION**
Mixing of unwanted substances in water.

**📉 SCARCITY**
Only **2.5% to 3%** of water present on earth is usable.

**🌊 SEA POLLUTION**
Caused by heavy metals, hydrocarbons, and petroleum.

### **9. Water Contaminants**

**🧪 CHEMICALS**
Carbonates, Sulphates of Mg/K, Ammonia, CO, $CO_2$, Industrial remains.

**☠️ ARSENIC**
Found as a pollutant in drinking water in some parts of **India**.

### **10. Water Diseases & Issues**

**🐟 MINIMATA DISEASE**
Caused by contaminated water containing **Mercury**.

**🛢️ OIL SPILL**
Oil from tankers spreads on sea surface (blocks oxygen).

### **11. Water Measurement & Care**

**📏 MEASUREMENT**
Pollution of river water is measured by **Oxygen dissolved** in it (DO/BOD).

**🧼 DISINFECTANTS**
Ozone, Chlorine dioxide, and Chloramines are used to disinfect water.

### **12. Sound Pollution**

**🔊 DEFINITION**
Unwanted and undesirable sound scattered in the atmosphere.

**📢 SOURCES**
Loud sound or noise.

**🌳 GREEN MUFFLER**
Technique/Plantation used against **noise pollution**.

### **13. Soil Pollution**

**🌍 DEFINITION**
Distorted form of soil which changes its chemical nature.

**🚮 SOURCES**
Acid rain, mine water, excessive fertilizers, germicides, garbage.

**➕ POSITIVE POLLUTION**
Due to excessive use of **fertilizers**.

### **14. Nuclear Pollution**

**☢️ DEFINITION**
Created by radioactive rays.

**🏭 SOURCES**
Medical treatment rays, Atomic reactor fuels, Nuclear weapons, Atomic power-house waste.

### **15. Ozone Depletion**

**🕳️ OZONE HOLE**
Pollutant responsible is **CFC** (Chlorofluorocarbon).

### **16. Waste Management**

**♻️ RECYCLING**
Best solution for non-biodegradable wastes.

**🪱 VERMI COMPOSTING**
Done by **worms**.

**🚫 DDT**
A non-biodegradable pollutant.

### **17. Population Terms I**

**👥 POPULATION**
Group of individuals of same species occupying same area at a given time.

**🏘️ DENSITY**
Total number of individuals present per unit area.

**👶 NATALITY**
Increase in number by **birth**.

### **18. Population Terms II**

**☠️ MORTALITY**
Number of individuals removed due to **death**.

**📈 BIOTIC POTENTIAL**
Maximum inherent capacity of an organism to reproduce.

### **19. Population Dynamics**

**🛑 ENVIRONMENTAL RESISTANCE**
Factors which put a check on the growth of population.

**💣 POPULATION EXPLOSION**
Dramatic increase in population size over a short period.

### **20. Demographic Transition**

**⚖️ BALANCE**
If **Birth Rate = Death Rate**.

**🏁 RESULT**
Zero population growth.
Called Demographic Transition.

### **21. Biological Interactions**

**🤝 MUTUALISM**
Functional association where **both** species are benefited.

**🤷 COMMENSALISM**
Association where **one** is benefited and the other is neither benefited nor affected.

### **22. Health & Society**

**🧠 PSYCHOSIS**
A mild form of mental illness (prolonged emotional reaction).

**💊 DRUG ABUSE**
Intake of drugs impairing physical, physiological, and psychological functions.

### **23. Biosphere & Energy**

**🌍 BIOSPHERE**
The space retaining life in any form.

**🔥 BIOGAS**
**Methane** released from biogas plant used as fuel gas.

### **24. Conservation Solutions**

**🌲 AFFORESTATION**
Prevents soil erosion.

**🗑️ NON-BIODEGRADABLE**
Best solution is recycling.

Classification of Animal Kingdom.content:
### **1. Kingdom Divisions**

**🌍 TWO SUB-KINGDOMS**
1. **Non-Chordata:** (Invertebrates)
2. **Chordata:** (Vertebrates)

**🔬 CELLULARITY**
*Protozoa:* Unicellular animals.
*Metazoa:* Multi-cellular animals.

### **2. Phylum Protozoa**

**🦠 MAIN FEATURES**
Unicellular (body made of one cell).
Parasitic or free-living.

**🌬️ PHYSIOLOGY**
Respiration and excretion take place by **diffusion**.

**📝 EXAMPLES**
*Amoeba, Euglena, Trypanosoma*.

### **3. Phylum Porifera (Sponges)**

**🌊 HABITAT**
Found in marine water.

**🕳️ PORES**
Numerous pores on body wall known as **Ostia**.

**🧱 SKELETON**
Made of minute calcareous or silicon spicules.

**🔊 USE**
Sponges are used as sound absorbers.

### **4. Phylum Coelenterata (Cnidaria)**

**🧱 ORGANIZATION**
First **tissue grade** organisation is found.

**🐙 TENTACLES**
Thread-like structures around the mouth for catching food.
Contains specialized **Cnidoblast** cells.

**⭕ SYMMETRY**
Radial symmetry.

**📝 EXAMPLES**
*Hydra, Jellyfish, Sea Anemone*.

### **5. Phylum Platyhelminthes**

**🪱 FLAT WORMS**
Dorso-ventrally flattened animals.
Triploblastic with **no body cavity** (Acoelomate).

**🔥 EXCRETION**
Takes place by **Flame Cells**.

**👫 GENDER**
Hermaphrodite (Bisexual).

**🤒 DISEASE**
*Taeniasis* is caused by Tapeworm.

### **6. Phylum Aschelminthes**

**🪱 ROUND WORMS**
Long, cylindrical, unsegmented worms.

**🚽 EXCRETION**
Takes place through **Protonephridia**.

**🦠 DISEASES**
*Ascaris* causes Ascariasis.
*Enterobius* (Pinworm) found in anus of children.
*Wuchereria bancrofti* causes Filarial disease.

### **7. Phylum Annelida**

**💍 SEGMENTATION**
Body bears **ring-like** structures (Annulus).
Metamerically segmented.

**🏃 LOCOMOTION**
Takes place through **Setae** made of Chitin.

**❤️ CIRCULATION**
Red blood (Iron present).
Earthworm has **4 pairs of hearts**.

**🚽 EXCRETION**
By **Nephridia**.

### **8. Phylum Arthropoda**

**🏆 LARGEST PHYLUM**
The largest phylum of Animalia.

**🦀 FEATURES**
**Jointed legs**.
Body covered with **Chitinous exoskeleton**.
Open circulatory system (Haemocoel).

**🚽 EXCRETION**
Main organ: **Malpighian tubules**.

### **9. Arthropoda Facts**

**🪳 COCKROACH**
Heart has **13 chambers**.
Blood is white (lack of pigment) called **Hemolymph**.

**🐜 SOCIAL INSECTS**
Ants and Termites live in colonies (labour division).

**🐛 SILK**
Obtained from pupa of silkworm.

### **10. Phylum Mollusca**

**🐚 FEATURES**
Soft bodies, often covered by a hard calcareous shell secreted by the **Mantle**.

**🩸 BLOOD**
Blue colour due to **Hemocyanin** (Copper-containing pigment).

**🚽 EXCRETION**
Through Kidneys.

**🦑 GIANT SQUID**
Largest spineless invertebrate.

### **11. Mollusca Examples**

**🐙 OCTOPUS**
Devil fish. Has **three hearts**.

**🦑 SEPIA**
Cuttle-fish.

**🐌 PILA**
Apple Snail.

### **12. Phylum Echinodermata**

**🌟 SPINY SKIN**
All animals are marine.

**💧 SYSTEM**
**Water vascular system** is present.
Tube feet used for locomotion.

**🏮 ARISTOTLE'S LANTERN**
Chewing apparatus found in **Sea Urchin**.

**⭐ REGENERATION**
Special capacity of regeneration (e.g., Star fish).

### **13. Phylum Chordata Basics**

**🧬 MAIN FEATURES**
1. Notochord present.
2. Dorsal hollow nerve cord.
3. Pharyngeal gill slits.

**🔢 DIVISIONS**
(a) Protochordates
(b) Vertebrata

### **14. Class Pisces (Fish)**

**🐟 FEATURES**
Aquatic, Cold-blooded.
Respiration through **Gills**.

**❤️ HEART**
**Two chambers**. Pumps only impure (deoxygenated) blood.

**📝 EXAMPLES**
*Scoliodon* (Dog fish), *Torpedo* (Electric ray), *Exocoetus* (Flying fish), *Hippocampus* (Sea horse).

### **15. Class Amphibia**

**🐸 DUAL LIFE**
Live on land and water.
Cold-blooded.

**❤️ HEART**
**Three chambers** (2 Auricles, 1 Ventricle).

**🌬️ RESPIRATION**
Gills, Skin, and Lungs.
*Note:* During hibernation, frogs respire through **skin**.

### **16. Class Reptilia**

**🦎 CRAWLING ANIMALS**
Cold-blooded, terrestrial or aquatic.

**🦴 SKELETON**
Flexible. Contains two pairs of limbs.

**🥚 EGGS**
Covered with shell made of Calcium Carbonate.

**🦖 ERA**
Mesozoic era is called the **Era of Reptiles**.

### **17. Reptile Facts**

**🐍 SNAKES**
*Cobra:* Only snake that makes nests.
*Hydrophis:* Sea snake, world's most poisonous.

**🦎 LIZARD**
*Heloderma:* The only poisonous lizard.

**☠️ VENOM**
Cobras emit venom through fangs.

### **18. Class Aves (Birds)**

**🦅 FEATURES**
Warm-blooded tetrapods.
Fore-feet modified into **wings**.

**🦴 BONES**
**Pneumatic bones** (hollow/air-filled) to help in flight.


**🦷 TEETH**
Birds have no teeth. Beak helps in feeding.

**❤️ HEART**
Four chambers.

### **19. Bird Facts**

**📉 SMALLEST**
Humming-bird.

**📈 LARGEST**
Ostrich (Alive).

**🏃 FLIGHTLESS**
Kiwi and Emu.

**🦜 COLORFUL**
Coppersmith Barbet is a bird with a well-patterned face.

### **20. Class Mammalia**

**🐒 FEATURES**
Warm-blooded.
Skin has **hair**, **sweat glands**, and **oil glands**.
External ear (**Pinna**) present.

**❤️ HEART**
Four chambers.

**🩸 RBC**
No nucleus in RBC (Except Camel and Lama).

### **21. Mammal Sub-classes**

**🥚 PROTOTHERIA**
Lays eggs.
*Ex:* Echidna, Platypus.

**🦘 METATHERIA**
Bears immature child.
*Ex:* Kangaroo.

**👶 EUTHERIA**
Bears well-developed child.
*Ex:* Human.

### **22. Mammal Facts**

**🌡️ TEMPERATURE**
Highest body temp: **Goat** (Avg 39°C).

**🧠 APES**
Smallest man-like ape: **Gibbon** (Note: Text says 'Orangutam' in facts section but Gibbon is generally smallest; preserving text 'Orangutam' as smallest man-like ape if strictly following image).

**🐋 DOLPHIN**
Group of dolphins is called a **Pod**.

### **23. Human Biological Facts**

**⚖️ pH RANGE**
Human body pH is between **7.35 to 7.45**.

**🌬️ RESPIRATION**
*Allantois* of mammalian embryo helps in respiration.

**👪 FAMILY**
Man belongs to the family of **'Hominidae'**.

### **24. Scientific Names: Pets & Farm**

**🐕 DOG**
*Canis lupus familiaris*

**🐈 CAT**
*Felis catus*

**🐎 HORSE**
*Equus caballus*

**🐖 PIG**
*Artiodactyla suidae* (Family name used in text)

**🐮 COW**
*Bos indicus* (implied from prev chapters)

### **25. Scientific Names: Wild Animals**

**🐆 CHEETAH**
*Acinonyx jubatus*

**🦁 LION**
*Panthera leo*

**🐅 TIGER**
*Panthera tigris*

**🐘 ELEPHANT**
*Proboscidea elephantidae*

**🦒 GIRAFFE**
*Giraffa camelopardalis*

### **26. Scientific Names: Reptiles & Amphibians**

**🐸 FROG**
*Anura ranidae*

**🐍 COBRA**
*Naja naja*

**🦎 LIZARD**
*Sauria lacetidae*

**🐊 CROCODILE**
(Group Reptilia)

### **27. Scientific Names: Small Creatures**

**🐁 MOUSE**
*Rodentia muridae*

**🦟 HOUSEFLY**
*Musca domestica*

**🐜 ANT**
*Hymenopetrous formicidae*

**🕷️ EARTHWORM**
*Pheretima posthuma* (General knowledge, text lists Earthworm in Annelida).

### **28. Scientific Names: Birds & Others**

**🐦 CROW**
*Corvus splendens*

**🦘 KANGAROO**
*Macropus macropodidae*

**🦏 RHINOCEROS**
*Perrissodanctyl rthinocerotidae*

**🦓 ZEBRA**
*Equidae burcheli*

Animal Tissue.content:
### **1. Classification of Tissues**

**🔢 CATEGORIES**
Animal tissues are divided into four main categories:
1. **Epithelial Tissue**
2. **Connective Tissue**
3. **Muscular Tissue**
4. **Nervous Tissue**

### **2. Epithelial Tissue: Structure**

**🛡️ COVERING**
Covers external body surface and internal free surface of organs.

**🧱 ARRANGEMENT**
Cells are arranged very close to each other.

**🩸 AVASCULAR**
**No blood vessels** supply nourishment. They receive nutrients from underlying connective tissue.

### **3. Epithelial Tissue: Functions**

**🛡️ PROTECTION**
Principle functions are **covering** and **lining** of free surfaces.

**📍 EXAMPLES**
Skin, Intestine, Glands, Hollow organs (Fallopian tube, Nasal passage, Bronchioles, Trachea).

### **4. Special Epithelium**

**🧹 CILIATED EPITHELIUM**
Lines the inner surface of:
* Fallopian tubes
* Bronchioles
* Bronchi

### **5. Connective Tissue: Overview**

**🔗 FUNCTION**
Connects and binds different tissues or organs.

**🏗️ SUPPORT**
Provides structural framework and mechanical support.

**🛡️ ROLES**
Defense tissue, repair, and fat storage.

### **6. Connective Tissue: Types**

**🥓 ADIPOSE**
Found beneath the skin (Fat storage).

**🦴 SKELETAL**
Cartilage and Bone.

**🩸 FLUID**
Blood is a connective tissue.

**🧵 FIBROUS**
Ligaments.

### **7. Ligaments**

**🦴 CONNECTION**
Connects **Bone to Bone**.

**🧱 NATURE**
A fibrous connective tissue.

### **8. Tendons**

**💪 CONNECTION**
Attaches **Muscle to Bone**.

**🧱 NATURE**
Flexible, inelastic cord of strong fibrous tissue.

### **9. Muscular Tissue: Basics**

**🏃 MOVEMENT**
Responsible for movement in the body.

**🧱 COMPOSITION**
Also known as **Contractile Tissue**.
Contains special **Contractile Protein** which helps in muscle movement.

### **10. Types of Muscles**

**🔢 THREE TYPES**
1. **Unstriped** (Smooth/Involuntary)
2. **Striped** (Skeletal/Voluntary)
3. **Cardiac** (Heart)

### **11. Unstriped Muscles**

**🚫 INVOLUNTARY**
Not controlled by will.
Control motions of organs that move on their own.

**📛 ALIAS**
Also known as **Smooth Muscles**.

### **12. Unstriped Muscle Locations**

**📍 FOUND IN**
* Alimentary Canal
* Rectum
* Ureter
* Blood Vessels
* Iris of Eye
* Bronchi of lung

### **13. Striped Muscles**

**🙋 VOLUNTARY**
Found in parts of the body that move voluntarily.

**🦴 ATTACHMENT**
Normally one or both ends connect with **bones** by tendons.

### **14. Cardiac Muscles**

**❤️ LOCATION**
Found only in the **wall of the heart**.

**⚡ ENDURANCE**
Contraction and expansion occur throughout life **without fail**.

### **15. Arrector Pili**

**🥶 GOOSEBUMPS**
Muscles found in the **skin**.

**👻 FUNCTION**
Make hair on the skin stand up straight when cold or frightened.

### **16. Muscle Facts: Count & Size**

**🔢 TOTAL**
Over **650** skeletal muscles in the human body.

**🐘 LARGEST**
**Gluteus Maximus** (Muscle of the hip).

### **17. Muscle Facts: Small & Strong**

**🤏 SMALLEST**
**Stapedius**.

**🦷 STRONGEST**
Found in the **Jaw** (based on weight).

### **18. Biological Note: Ions**

**🧪 CONCENTRATION**
In vertebrates, inside the cell and tissues:
* Low concentration of **$K^+$** (Potassium).
* High concentration of **$Na^+$** (Sodium).
*(Note: Based on source text).*

### **19. Nervous Tissue: Overview**

**🧠 SENSORY**
Also called **Sensory Tissue**.
Forms the nervous system of organisms.

### **20. Nervous Tissue Components**

**🧱 CELLS**
Made up of two specific cells:
1. **Nerve cell** or **Neurons**
2. **Neuroglia**

### **21. Nervous Tissue Function**

**🎮 CONTROL**
Controls all the **voluntary** and **involuntary** activities of the body.

Human Blood.content:
### **1. Blood: General Facts**

**🩸 TISSUE TYPE**
Blood is a **Connective Tissue**.

**⚖️ QUANTITY**
Constitutes about **7%** of the total body weight.

**💧 VOLUME**
Approximately **5 to 6 liters** of blood in an adult human.

### **2. Blood: pH and Composition**

**🧪 pH**
Blood pH is **7.4**, which is **Alkaline** in nature.

**⚖️ COMPONENTS**
1. **Plasma** (55-60%)
2. **Blood Corpuscles / Cells** (40-45%)

### **3. Plasma Composition**

**💧 WATER**
Plasma is mostly **90% water**.

**🥩 PROTEIN**
Contains about **7% Protein**.

**🍬 OTHERS**
Contains **0.9% Salt** and **0.1% Glucose**.

### **4. Plasma Proteins**

**🛡️ CLOTTING FACTORS**
**Prothrombin** and **Fibrinogen** (Help in clotting).

**🩺 OTHERS**
**Albumin** and **Globulin**.

### **5. Blood Corpuscles (Cells)**

**🔢 THREE TYPES**
1. **RBC** (Red Blood Corpuscles)
2. **WBC** (White Blood Corpuscles)
3. **Blood Platelets** (Thrombocytes)

### **6. RBC (Erythrocytes): Structure**

**⚫ NUCLEUS**
**Absent** in RBC (Except in Camel and Lama).

**🧱 FORMATION**
Formed in the **Bone Marrow**.

### **7. RBC: Hemoglobin**

**🔴 COLOR**
Contains **Hemoglobin** (Iron-containing protein) which gives blood its red color.

**💨 FUNCTION**
Hemoglobin is responsible for the transport of **Oxygen** in the body.

### **8. RBC: Count and Lifespan**

**🔢 COUNT**
About **5 million** per cubic millimeter ($mm^3$).

**🗓️ LIFESPAN**
**120 days**.

### **9. RBC: Destruction**

**⚰️ DESTRUCTION SITE**
Destroyed in the **Spleen**.

**🦴 NICKNAME**
Spleen is known as the **Graveyard of RBC**.

### **10. WBC (Leukocytes): Basics**

**⚪ NUCLEUS**
**Present** in WBC.

**🗓️ LIFESPAN**
Very short lifespan: **2 to 4 days**.

### **11. WBC: Count and Formation**

**🔢 COUNT**
About **8,000 to 10,000** per cubic millimeter ($mm^3$).

**📊 RATIO**
RBC : WBC ratio is **600 : 1**.

**🧱 FORMATION**
Formed in Bone Marrow, Lymph nodes, and Spleen.

### **12. WBC: Function**

**🛡️ IMMUNITY**
Main function is **Defense** (Immunity) against diseases.

**🦠 MECHANISM**
Engulfs the bacteria, acting as the body's defensive system.

### **13. WBC: Granulocytes**

**🔬 GRANULAR TYPES**
1. **Neutrophils** (60-70%)
2. **Eosinophils** (2-4%)
3. **Basophils** (0.5-1%)

### **14. WBC: Agranulocytes**

**🔬 NON-GRANULAR TYPES**
1. **Lymphocytes** (20-25%)
2. **Monocytes** (3-8%)

### **15. Blood Platelets (Thrombocytes)**

**⚫ NUCLEUS**
**Absent** in Blood Platelets.

**🧱 FORMATION**
Formed in the **Bone Marrow**.

**🗓️ LIFESPAN**
Short lifespan of **3 to 5 days**.

### **16. Platelets: Clotting & Count**

**🩹 FUNCTION**
Helps in the **clotting** of blood.

**🔢 COUNT**
About **2 to 5 lakhs** per cubic millimeter ($mm^3$).

### **17. Blood Clotting Process**

**🧪 STEP 1**
**Fibrinogen** is changed into **Fibrin** in the presence of **Thrombin**.

**🧪 STEP 2**
**Prothrombin** is changed into **Thrombin** by **Thromboplastin** and **Calcium ions** ($Ca^{++}$).

### **18. Serum Definition**

**💧 SERUM**
When blood is clotted, the remaining clear fluid is called **Serum**.

**⚗️ COMPOSITION**
Serum is equivalent to **Plasma minus Fibrinogen**.

### **19. Blood Groups Discovery**

**👨‍🔬 DISCOVERER**
Discovered by **Landsteiner** in **1900**.

**🧬 COMPONENTS**
Group classification is based on **Antigens** on RBC and **Antibodies** in Plasma.

### **20. Blood Group Antigens**

**🅰️ GROUP A**
Antigen **A** (on RBC surface).
Antibody **b** (in Plasma).

**🅱️ GROUP B**
Antigen **B**.
Antibody **a**.

### **21. Blood Group O and AB**

**🅾️ GROUP O**
**No Antigen**.
Antibodies **a and b**.

**🆎 GROUP AB**
Antigens **A and B**.
**No Antibody**.

### **22. Universal Donor & Recipient**

**🎁 UNIVERSAL DONOR**
Blood group **O** (due to having no antigens).

**📥 UNIVERSAL RECIPIENT**
Blood group **AB** (due to having no antibodies).

### **23. Rh Factor**

**🐒 DISCOVERY**
Discovered by **Landsteiner and Wiener** in **1940**.

**🧪 ORIGIN**
First found in the **Rhesus monkey**.

**🤰 IMPORTANCE**
Very important for blood transfusion and pregnancy management.

### **24. Blood Storage**

**🏥 BLOOD BANK**
Blood is stored in a **low temperature** to keep it fresh.

**🧪 ANTI-CLOTTING AGENTS**
**Sodium citrate** or **Sodium Oxalate** is added to prevent clotting.

System of the Human Body.content:
### **1. Digestive System: Overview**

**🔄 5 STAGES**
1. **Ingestion:** Taking food into mouth.
2. **Digestion:** Converting non-absorbable food to absorbable.
3. **Absorption:** Digested food mixing into blood.
4. **Assimilation:** Use of absorbed food.
5. **Defecation:** Removal of waste.

### **2. Digestion in Mouth**

**🤤 SALIVA**
Secreted by salivary glands. pH is slightly acidic (**6.8 to 7.3**).
Daily secretion: Approx **1.5 litres**.

**🧪 ENZYME**
**Ptyalin** (Salivary Amylase): Converts Starch ➝ Simple Sugar (Maltose).

**🦷 TEETH**
**Molars** are used for grinding food.

### **3. Digestion in Stomach**

**⏳ TIME**
Food lies for approximately **4 hours**.

**⚗️ GASTRIC JUICE**
Light yellow acidic liquid (pH **1.5 to 3.5**).
Contains **HCl** (Hydrochloric Acid) secreted by **Oxyntic cells** to kill bacteria.

**🧪 ENZYMES**
1. **Pepsin:** Breaks Protein ➝ Peptones.
2. **Renin:** Breaks Caseinogen (Milk) ➝ Casein.

### **4. Digestion in Intestine**

**📏 SMALL INTESTINE**
Sub-divided into **Duodenum**, **Jejunum**, and **Ileum**.
Digestion is completed here.

**🟢 BILE**
Comes from Liver. Turns acidic food **Alkaline**.

**🧱 ABSORPTION**
Takes place through **Villi** found in the wall of Ileum.

### **5. Pancreatic Juice**

**🧪 ENZYMES (TAL)**
1. **Trypsin:** Protein/Peptone ➝ Polypeptides.
2. **Amylase:** Starch ➝ Soluble Sugar.
3. **Lipase:** Emulsified Fats ➝ Glycerol/Fatty Acids.

**🍽️ APPETITE SUPPRESSOR**
**Cholecystokinin** induces release of digestive enzymes.

### **6. Intestinal Juice**

**🧪 ENZYMES**
1. **Erepsin:** Protein ➝ Amino acids.
2. **Maltase:** Maltose ➝ Glucose.
3. **Sucrase:** Sucrose ➝ Glucose + Fructose.
4. **Lactase:** Lactose ➝ Glucose + Galactose.

**💧 QUANTITY**
Healthy humans secrete **2 litres** daily.

### **7. The Liver**

**🏆 LARGEST GLAND**
Weight: Approx **1500 gram**.

**🟢 BILE PRODUCTION**
Secretes Bile (pH 7.7, Alkaline). Stored in **Gall Bladder**.

**🛡️ FUNCTIONS**
* Converts excess Amino acid ➝ Ammonia ➝ **Urea** (Ornithine cycle).
* Produces **Fibrinogen** & **Heparin** (Clotting proteins).
* Destroys dead RBCs.

### **8. The Pancreas**

**✌️ DUAL NATURE**
Acts as simultaneously **Endocrine** and **Exocrine** gland.

**🏝️ ISLETS OF LANGERHANS**
* **Beta cells:** Secrete **Insulin**.
* **Alpha cells:** Secrete **Glucagon**.
* **Delta cells:** Secrete **Somatostatin**.

### **9. Insulin & Diabetes**

**💉 INSULIN**
Discovered by **Banting and Best** (1921).
Controls conversion of Glucose ➝ Glycogen.

**🍭 DIABETES**
Caused by **deficiency** of Insulin.

**📉 HYPOGLYCEMIA**
Caused by **excessive flow** of Insulin (Visual disturbance/loss of consciousness).

### **10. Respiratory System**

**🌬️ ORGANS**
Nasal passage ➝ Pharynx ➝ Larynx (Voice box) ➝ Trachea ➝ Bronchi ➝ Lungs.

**🫁 LUNGS**
Right lung is larger than left. Covered by **Pleural Membrane**.

**👃 NASAL PASSAGE**
Lined with mucous membrane. Regulates air temperature (AC of body).

### **11. Mechanism of Breathing**

**😤 INSPIRATION**
Diaphragm is **flattened**. Air enters lungs.

**😮‍💨 EXPIRATION**
Diaphragm is **arched**. Air leaves lungs.

**⏱️ RATE**
Adult breathes **12-16 times** per minute.

### **12. Cellular Respiration**

**🔄 TYPES**
1. **Anaerobic:** Without Oxygen. Produces **Lactic Acid** (in muscles) or Ethyl Alcohol. (2 ATP).
2. **Aerobic:** With Oxygen. Complete oxidation of glucose. (38 ATP).

**🧬 GLYCOLYSIS**
Occurs in **Cytoplasm**. Also called **EMP path**.

**⚙️ KREB'S CYCLE**
Occurs in **Mitochondria**. Also called **Citric Acid Cycle**.

### **13. Circulatory System: Heart**

**❤️ STRUCTURE**
Four chambers (2 Auricles, 2 Ventricles).
Enclosed in **Pericardial membrane**.
Weight: **300 grams**.

**🚪 VALVES**
*Right Side:* **Tricuspid** Valve.
*Left Side:* **Bicuspid** Valve.

### **14. Heart Function**

**💓 HEART BEAT**
Beats **72 times/min**.
Contraction = **Systole**. Relaxation = **Diastole**.

**⚡ PACEMAKER**
**SA Node** (Sinoatrial node) generates cardiac impulses.

**🩸 BLOOD PRESSURE**
Normal: **120/80**. Measured by **Sphygmomanometer**.

### **15. Blood Vessels**

**🔴 ARTERIES**
Carry blood **from heart** to body.
Carry **Pure (Oxygenated)** blood (Except Pulmonary Artery).

**🔵 VEINS**
Carry blood **from body** to heart.
Carry **Impure (Deoxygenated)** blood (Except Pulmonary Vein).

### **16. Excretory System**

**🚿 EXCRETION**
Removal of nitrogenous waste (Urea, Ammonia).
Main organs: **Kidneys**, Skin, Liver, Lungs.

**🩹 HEMODIALYSIS**
Artificial kidney used to remove excess urea from blood.

### **17. The Kidney**

**⚖️ SPECS**
Weight: **140g**. Two parts: **Cortex** (Outer) & **Medulla** (Inner).

**🌀 NEPHRON**
Functional unit of kidney. Contains **Bowman's Capsule** and **Glomerulus**.

**💧 URINE**
Light yellow due to **Urochrome**.
pH is **6** (Acidic).
Stones are made of **Calcium Oxalate**.

### **18. Nervous System Overview**

**🧠 UNIT**
**Neuron** (Nerve cell).

**⚡ DIVISIONS**
1. **Central** (Brain + Spinal Cord)
2. **Peripheral** (Cranial + Spinal nerves)
3. **Autonomic** (Sympathetic + Parasympathetic)

### **19. The Brain: Forebrain**

**🧠 CEREBRUM**
Largest part. Seat of **wisdom, memory, will power**.

**🌡️ THALAMUS**
Centre of pain, cold, and heat.

**🌡️ HYPOTHALAMUS**
Controls **body temperature**, hunger, thirst, and emotional reactions.

### **20. The Brain: Hindbrain**

**🌳 CEREBELLUM**
Controls **body balance** and muscular coordination.

**⚙️ MEDULLA OBLONGATA**
Controls **involuntary actions** (Heart beat, respiration, BP).
Connects brain to spinal cord.

### **21. Nervous System Facts**

**⚡ REFLEX ACTION**
Controlled by **Spinal Cord**. Discovered by **Marshall Hall**.

**📈 EEG**
Electroencephalography. Used to know the function of the **Brain**.

**😴 CRANIAL NERVES**
12 Pairs.

**⚡ SPINAL NERVES**
31 Pairs.

### **22. Autonomic Nervous System**

**😡 SYMPATHETIC**
Active in fear/pain/anger.
Increases heart beat, respiration, BP.

**😌 PARASYMPATHETIC**
Active in rest/joy.
Creates contraction in pupil and bladder.

### **23. Skeletal System**

**🦴 BONE COUNTS**
Adult: **206**.
Childhood: **270**.
Head: **29**.
Vertebral Column: **33** (initially) ➝ **26** (developed).
Ribs: **24**.

### **24. Specific Bones**

**🦵 FEMUR**
Longest and strongest bone (Thigh).

**👂 STAPES**
Smallest bone (Ear).

**💀 FORAMEN MAGNUM**
Aperture found in the skull.

**🦴 ATLAS**
First vertebra holding the skull.

### **25. Endocrine System: Pituitary**

**👑 MASTER GLAND**
Situated in Sella-turcica (Forehead).

**🧪 HORMONES**
**STH:** Growth hormone (Gigantism/Dwarfism).
**TSH:** Thyroid stimulating.
**Oxytocin:** Milk release & Birth contraction.
**ADH:** Water balance.

### **26. Thyroid & Parathyroid**

**🦋 THYROID**
Secretes **Thyroxine** (Contains Iodine).
Deficiency: **Goitre**, Cretinism (in children).

**🦴 PARATHYROID**
Regulates **Calcium** level in blood.
Deficiency causes Tetany.

### **27. Adrenal Glands**

**🚨 EMERGENCY GLAND**
Secretes **Adrenaline** (Epinephrine).

**🚀 FIGHT OR FLIGHT**
Prepares body for emergency. Increases heartbeat and BP.
Located on top of kidneys.

### **28. Gonads (Sex Hormones)**

**👩 OVARY**
**Estrogen:** Reproductive development.
**Progesterone:** Uterus thickening.
**Relaxin:** Widens cervix during birth.

**👨 TESTIS**
**Testosterone:** Secondary sexual characters in males.

Nutrients.content:
### **1. Basics of Nutrition**

**🍽️ DEFINITION**
Process by which organisms perform basic functions of life (intake, digestion, absorption, assimilation, egestion).

**🧪 NUTRIENTS**
Substances by which an organism gets **energy** or uses for **biosynthesis**.

**🔋 ENERGY SOURCE**
Carbohydrates and Fats.

**🏗️ BIOSYNTHESIS**
Proteins and Minerals.

### **2. Carbohydrates**

**⚗️ RATIO**
Carbon, Hydrogen, Oxygen (**1 : 2 : 1**).

**🔋 IMPORTANCE**
Major intake in animals and humans (50-75% energy obtained).
1 gram = **4.2 Kcal** energy.

**⚛️ CHEMISTRY**
Aldehyde group = **Aldose**.
Ketone group = **Ketose**.

### **3. Classification of Carbs**

**1️⃣ MONOSACCHARIDES**
Simple sugar. Most abundant is **Glucose** ($C_6H_{12}O_6$).
Sweetest sugar is **Fructose**.

**2️⃣ OLIGOSACCHARIDES**
2 to 10 monosaccharides. Sweet and crystalline.
*Ex:* Maltose, Sucrose, Lactose.

**3️⃣ POLYSACCHARIDES**
Insoluble and tasteless.
*Ex:* Starch, Glycogen, Cellulose, Chitin.

### **4. Carbohydrate Functions**

**⛽ FUEL**
Glucose breaks into $CO_2$ and $H_2O$ releasing energy (Respiration).

**🧬 GENETICS**
Nucleic acids are polymers containing **Pentose sugar**.

**🥛 LACTOSE**
Sugar formed from Glucose and Galactose (found in milk).

**🏗️ EXOSKELETON**
Carbon skeleton used to form fatty acids, chitin, cellulose.

### **5. Proteins: Structure**

**🧱 AMINO ACIDS**
Complex organic compound made of **20 types** of amino acids.
**Nitrogen** is essential for protein synthesis.

**🗓️ HISTORY**
Word first used by **J. Berzelius**.

**🧬 SYNTHESIS**
12 synthesized by body.
8 obtained from food (**Essential Amino Acids**).

### **6. Protein Types**

**1️⃣ SIMPLE**
Consists only of amino acids.
*Ex:* Albumins, Globulins, Histones.

**2️⃣ CONJUGATED**
Has another chemical compound added.
*Ex:* Chromo protein, Glyco protein.

**3️⃣ DERIVED**
Derived from partial digestion/hydrolysis.
*Ex:* Peptone, Peptide.

### **7. Protein Facts**

**🥇 FIRST CLASS**
Animal protein is called first class because it contains **all essential amino acids**.

**💅 KERATIN**
Protein that protects epithelial cells from damage (found in nails).

**🌱 SOYABEAN**
Richest source of protein.

### **8. Protein Deficiency Diseases**

**🧒 KWASHIORKOR**
Hands/legs get slimmed, stomach comes out.

**💀 MARASMUS**
Muscles of children are loosened.

### **9. Fats (Lipids)**

**⚗️ CHEMISTRY**
Ester of **Glycerol** and **Fatty Acid**.

**🌡️ STATE**
Solid at 20°C = Fat.
Liquid at 20°C = Oil.

**⚡ ENERGY**
**9.3 Kcal** energy liberated from 1 gram fat (Maximum energy per gram).

### **10. Types of Fatty Acids**

**🛑 SATURATED**
Coconut oil, Palm oil.

**💧 UNSATURATED**
Fish oil, Vegetable oil.

**🤢 RANCIDITY**
Oxidation of fat/oils changing taste and smell.

### **11. Vitamins Overview**

**👨‍🔬 DISCOVERY**
Invented by **Sir F.G. Hopkins**.
Term coined by **Funk**.

**⚖️ NATURE**
Organic compound required in minute quantities.
**No calorie** obtained, but regulates metabolism.

### **12. Classification of Vitamins**

**💧 WATER SOLUBLE**
Vitamin **B** and **C**.

**🥓 FAT SOLUBLE**
Vitamin **A, D, E,** and **K**.

### **13. Vitamin A**

**🧪 CHEMICAL NAME**
**Retinol**.

**👁️ DEFICIENCY**
Colour blindness, **Xerophthalmia**, Night blindness.

**🥕 SOURCES**
Carrot, Milk, Egg, Cod liver oil.
*Note:* Mainly stored in **Liver**.

### **14. Vitamin B1 & B2**

**1️⃣ B1 (THIAMINE)**
Deficiency: **Beriberi**.
Source: Groundnut, Rapeseed.
*Note:* Polished rice diet causes Beriberi.

**2️⃣ B2 (RIBOFLAVIN)**
Deficiency: Cracking of skin, reddish eye, mouth ulcers.

### **15. Vitamin B3, B5, B6**

**3️⃣ B3 (NIACIN)**
Deficiency: Whitening of hair, **Pellagra**.

**5️⃣ B5 (PANTOTHENIC ACID)**
Deficiency: Insomnia, burning feet.

**6️⃣ B6 (PYRIDOXINE)**
Deficiency: Anaemia, skin disease, depression.

### **16. Vitamin B7, B11, B12**

**7️⃣ B7 (BIOTIN)**
Deficiency: Paralysis, hair falling.

**1️⃣1️⃣ B11/B9 (FOLIC ACID)**
Deficiency: Anaemia, dysentery.

**1️⃣2️⃣ B12 (CYANOCOBALAMIN)**
Deficiency: **Pernicious Anaemia**, Jaundice.
*Fact:* Contains **Cobalt**.

### **17. Vitamin C**

**🧪 CHEMICAL NAME**
**Ascorbic Acid**.

**🦷 DEFICIENCY**
**Scurvy**, swelling of gums, bleeding gums.

**🍋 SOURCES**
Sour substances (Lemon, Orange), Chilly.
*Fact:* Amla is the richest source.

### **18. Vitamin D**

**🧪 CHEMICAL NAME**
**Calciferol**.

**🦴 DEFICIENCY**
**Rickets** (Children), **Osteomalacia** (Adults).

**☀️ SYNTHESIS**
Synthesized by sunlight through cholesterol (**Ergosterol**) of skin.

### **19. Vitamin E & K**

**✨ VITAMIN E (TOCOPHEROL)**
Deficiency: **Less fertility**.
Source: Wheat germ oil, leafy vegetables.

**🩸 VITAMIN K (PHYLLOQUINONE)**
Deficiency: **Non-clotting of blood**.
*Fact:* Synthesized in colon by bacteria.

### **20. Minerals: Na & K**

**🧂 SODIUM (Na)**
Source: Salt.
Function: Nerve impulse transmission, blood pressure control.

**🍌 POTASSIUM (K)**
Source: All edibles.
Function: Heart beat regulation, nerve conduction.

### **21. Minerals: Ca & P**

**🦴 CALCIUM (Ca)**
Source: Milk, Cheese, Eggs.
Function: Strength to bones/teeth, **Blood clotting**, Muscle contraction.

**🦴 PHOSPHORUS (P)**
Source: Green leafy vegetables.
Function: Strength to bones/teeth.

### **22. Minerals: Iron & Iodine**

**🩸 IRON (Fe)**
Source: Spinach, Apple, Banana.
Function: Formation of **Hemoglobin** (RBC).

**🦋 IODINE (I)**
Source: Sea food, Iodized salt.
Function: Synthesis of **Thyroxin** (Thyroid gland).

### **23. Trace Minerals & Facts**

**🦷 FLUORINE**
Excess causes **Fluorosis**. Deficiency leads to mottling of teeth.

**🌱 MOLYBDENUM**
Affects Nitrogenase activity in plants.

**🤰 PREGNANCY**
Deficiency of Calcium and Iron is common in pregnant women.

### **24. Water**

**⚖️ QUANTITY**
**65-75%** of body weight.

**🌡️ FUNCTIONS**
Controls body temperature (sweating/vaporizing).
Important way of excretion.
Medium for hydrolysis reactions.

### **25. Balanced Diet**

**🥗 DEFINITION**
Nutrition in which all important nutrients are available in sufficient quantity.

### **26. Calorie Requirements**

**🛌 LIGHT WORKER**
Male: 2000 | Female: 2100

**🏢 8 HOURS WORK**
Male: 3000 | Female: 2500

**🏗️ HARD WORKER**
Male: **3600** | Female: **3000**

### **27. Food Facts**

**🍆 BT-BRINJAL**
Genetically modified vegetable in India.

**🥫 PRESERVATIVE**
**Sodium Benzoate** is used to preserve food items.

**🥛 MILK**
Not a complete food due to lack of **Vitamin C** and **Iron**.

Human Diseases.content:
### **1. Protozoan Diseases: Malaria**

**🦟 VECTOR**
Female **Anopheles** mosquito.

**🦠 PARASITE**
*Plasmodium*.

**🤒 SYMPTOMS**
Fever with shivering. Affects **RBC & Liver**.

**🩸 PERNICIOUS MALARIA**
Malignant malaria caused by *Plasmodium falciparum*.

### **2. Malaria History & Cure**

**👨‍🔬 DISCOVERY**
Parasite discovered by **Charles Leveran** (1880).
Transmission confirmed by **Ronald Ross** (1897).

**💊 CURE**
**Quinine**: Effective medicine obtained from the bark of **Cinchona** tree.

### **3. Protozoan Diseases: Others**

**🦷 PYORRHOEA**
Parasite: *Entamoeba gingivalis*. Affects **Gums** (Bleeding).

**😴 SLEEPING SICKNESS**
Parasite: *Trypanosoma*. Carrier: **Tse-Tse flies**. Affects **Brain**.

**🦴 KALA-AZAR**
Parasite: *Leishmania donovani*. Carrier: **Sand flies**. Affects **Bone Marrow**.

### **4. Protozoan Diseases: Diarrhoea**

**🦠 PARASITE**
*Entamoeba histolytica*.

**🏠 TRANSMISSION**
Spread through **house flies**.

**⚠️ EFFECT**
Causes wounds in intestine. Destroys protein-digesting enzyme **Trypsin**.
Mostly found in children.

### **5. Bacterial Diseases: Respiratory**

**🫁 TUBERCULOSIS (TB)**
Bacteria: *Mycobacterium tuberculosis*.
Affects: Lungs.
Also known as **White Plague**.

**🗣️ WHOOPING COUGH**
Bacteria: *Hemophilus pertussis*.
Symptom: Continuous coughing.

**🌡️ PNEUMONIA**
Bacteria: *Streptococcus pneumoniae*.
Symptom: High fever, swelling in lungs.

### **6. Bacterial Diseases: Intestinal**

**🤢 CHOLERA**
Bacteria: *Vibrio cholerae*.
Symptom: Continuous stool and vomiting.

**🤒 TYPHOID**
Bacteria: *Salmonella typhi*.
Symptom: High fever, headache.
Probability increases with contaminated drinking water.

### **7. Bacterial Diseases: Skin & Nerves**

**😬 TETANUS**
Bacteria: *Clostridium tetani*.
Affects: Nervous system (Lockjaw/Spasm).

**🤕 LEPROSY**
Bacteria: *Mycobacterium leprae*.
Affects: Nervous System, Skin (Spots on body).

### **8. Bacterial Diseases: Sexual/Urinary**

**🚻 GONORRHEA**
Bacteria: *Neisseria gonorrhoeae*.
Affects: Urinary path (Swelling).

**🔞 SYPHILIS**
Bacteria: *Treponema pallidum*.
Affects: Urinogenital tract (Wounds).

### **9. Bacterial Diseases: Others**

**🐀 PLAGUE**
Bacteria: *Pasteurella pestis*.
Affects: Lungs, area between two legs.

**👁️ TRACHOMA**
Bacteria: *Chlamydia trachomatis*.
Affects: Eye (Red eyes, pain).

**👃 DIPHTHERIA**
Bacteria: *Corynebacterium diphtheriae*.
Affects: Respiratory tube (Suffocation).

### **10. Bacterial Discovery Facts**

**👨‍🔬 ROBERT KOCH**
German scientist who discovered bacteria of **Cholera** and **TB** (1882).

**🐔 BIRD FLU**
Affects human beings and spreads through **poultry**.

**🦠 ANTHRAX**
Disease caused by bacteria.

### **11. Viral Diseases: Poxes**

**🐔 CHICKEN POX**
Virus: *Varicella-Zoster Virus (VZV)*.
Symptom: Itchy rashes, fluid blisters.

**🤒 SMALL POX**
Virus: *Variola Virus*.
Symptom: Eruption of boils. (Eradicated).

### **12. Viral Diseases: Fevers**

**🦟 DENGUE**
Transmitted by **Aedes aegypti** mosquito.
Also known as **Break Bone Fever**.

**🦠 MEASLES**
Virus: *Morbilli Virus*.
Symptom: Red rashes, runny nose.

### **13. Viral Diseases: Organs**

**🧠 MENINGITIS**
Affects: Brain and Spinal cord.

**🥃 HEPATITIS (JAUNDICE)**
Affects: **Liver**.
Symptom: Dark yellow urine, yellow eyes.

**😮 MUMPS**
Affects: **Salivary gland**.
Symptom: Swelling, pain.

### **14. Viral Diseases: Nervous**

**🐕 RABIES (HYDROPHOBIA)**
Transmitted by **dog bite**.
Symptom: Fear of water, high fever, mental confusion.

**♿ POLIO**
Virus: *Polio Virus*.
Affects: Throat, Intestine ➝ Brain/Spinal cord ➝ Paralysis.

### **15. AIDS / HIV**

**🦠 FULL FORM**
**A**cquired **I**mmuno **D**eficiency **S**yndrome.

**🛡️ EFFECT**
HIV infects **helper lymphocytes**, making immune system weak.

**🧪 TEST**
**ELISA** Test (Enzyme-Linked Immunosorbent Assay).

### **16. COVID-19 & Recent Viruses**

**🦠 COVID-19**
Caused by **SARS-CoV-2**. Affects respiratory system.
Vaccines: **Covishield** (Serum Institute).

**🦇 NIPAH**
Antibody found in bats from **Mahabaleshwar cave**.

**🐷 H1N1**
Related to **Swine Flu**.

**🦟 ZIKA**
Transmitted by daytime active *Aedes* mosquito.

### **17. Vaccines & Immunization**

**💉 DPT**
Diptheria, Pertussis, Tetanus.

**💉 BCG**
Bacillus Calmette-Guerin (For TB).

**💧 OPV**
Oral Polio Vaccine.

**🇮🇳 MISSION INDRADHANUSH**
Launched in 2014 to cover partially/unvaccinated children.

### **18. Fungal Diseases: Skin**

**🦶 ATHLETE'S FOOT**
Fungus: *Tenia Pedis*.
Cracking of feet skin.

**🧴 SCABIES**
Fungus: *Acarus scabies*.
Itching and white spots on skin.

**💍 RINGWORM**
Fungus: *Trichophyton Lerucosum*.
Round red spots on skin.

### **19. Fungal Diseases: Others**

**🫁 ASTHMA**
Fungus: *Aspergillus fumigatus*.
Spores form a net in lungs, obstructing function.

**👨‍🦲 BALDNESS**
Fungus: *Taenia capitis*.
Hair of the head falls.

### **20. Helminthic Disease**

**🦟 FILARIA**
Pathogen: *Wuchereria bancrofti* (Worm).
Vector: **Culex mosquitoes**.
Symptom: Swelling in legs (Elephantiasis) and testes.

### **21. Medical Instruments I**

**💓 PACEMAKER**
Small device placed in chest to control **abnormal heart beat**.

**🩻 CT SCAN**
Computed Tomography Scan. Investigates abnormal body function.

**📉 ECG**
Electro Cardiograph. Detects heart abnormality.

### **22. Medical Instruments II**

**🧠 EEG**
Electro Encephalogram. Detects **brain malfunctioning**.

**🧲 MRI**
Magnetic Resonance Imaging. Finds abnormality in whole body.

**👃 RHINOSCOPE**
Instrument for examining the **nose**.

**👶 ULTRASONIC WAVES**
Used to know growth of **fetus**.

### **23. Eye Defects**

**👓 MYOPIA**
Short-sightedness. Corrected by **Concave lens**.

**👓 HYPERMETROPIA**
Long-sightedness. Corrected by **Convex lens**.

**👴 PRESBYOPIA**
Loss of flexibility of lens due to age. Corrected by **Bifocal lens**.

**👀 DIPLOPIA**
Paralysis of eye muscles causes **double image**.

### **24. Cancer Types**

**🦀 CARCINOMA**
Skin/Epithelial cancer caused by **UV rays**.

**🍖 SARCOMA**
Cancer of connective tissue, bones, cartilage, muscles.

**🩸 LEUKAEMIA**
Abnormal growth of **leucocytes** (Blood cancer).

**💊 CHEMOTHERAPY**
Used in treatment of cancer.

### **25. Heart & Blood Conditions**

**🩸 HAEMOPHILIA**
Genetic disease where blood **loses ability to clot**.

**💓 ATHEROSCLEROSIS**
Deposition of cholesterol in arteries preventing blood flow.

**🪵 ARTERIOSCLEROSIS**
Calcium salts make arteries stiff/rigid (loss of elasticity).

### **26. Blood Sugar Disorders**

**🍬 HYPERGLYCEMIA**
High concentration of glucose in blood.

**📉 HYPOGLYCEMIA**
Very low concentration of glucose in blood.

**🚽 GLYCOSURIA**
Presence of excess glucose in **urine**.

### **27. Bone & Joint Diseases**

**🔥 ARTHRITIS**
Inflammation of joints.

**🦴 OSTEOPOROSIS**
Age-dependent disorder. Low bone mass and increased fragility.

**🤕 RHEUMATISM**
Fever with joint pain.

### **28. Mental & Neurological**

**🧠 SCHIZOPHRENIA**
Patient considers imagination as truth. Found in youth.

**⚡ EPILEPSY**
Abnormal electrical discharge in brain causing **seizures** and foaming.

**😵 DELIRIUM**
Mental disturbance under influence of poisonous drugs.

### **29. Respiratory Conditions**

**🌬️ BRONCHITIS**
Inflammation of tubes leading to lungs.

**🫁 EMPHYSEMA**
Loss of elasticity in alveoli. Caused by **cigarette smoke**.

**🤒 PNEUMONIA**
Acute inflammation of alveoli.

### **30. Dietary & Metabolic**

**⚖️ OBESITY**
Excessive fatness measured by **BMI**.

**🍔 BULIMIA**
Disorder where man does not know when to **stop eating**.

**🍌 HYPOKALEMIA**
Deficiency of mineral **Potassium**.

### **31. Miscellaneous Diseases I**

**😖 COLIC**
Severe abdominal pain caused by spasm of internal organs.

**🤧 ALLERGY**
Reaction to substances (dust, smoke) causing itching/pimples.

**🤕 PARALYSIS**
Nerves become inactive due to high BP bursting blood vessels.

### **32. Miscellaneous Diseases II**

**🧱 SIDEROSIS**
Caused by inhalation of **Iron dust**.

**🚽 PILES**
Varicose veins in rectum due to constipation.

**🚽 UREMIA**
Excess **urea** in blood due to kidney malfunction.

Miscellaneous.content:
### **1. Cell Biology: Introduction**

**🧱 CELL**
Basic structural and functional unit of life.

**👑 NUCLEUS**
Brain of the cell. Contains **DNA/Chromosomes**.

**📏 SIZES**
*Largest Cell:* **Ostrich egg**.
*Smallest Cell:* **P.P.L.O.** (Mycoplasma) / **Mycoplasma Gallisepticum**.

### **2. Cell Organelles I**

**📦 GOLGI BODY**
Packaging, modification, and transport of proteins/lipids.

**🔬 RIBOSOME**
Site of **Protein Synthesis** (also called Protein factory).

**⚙️ MITOCHONDRIA**
Site of aerobic respiration (**Power House of the Cell**).

### **3. Cell Organelles II**

**🛡️ CELL WALL**
Outer covering of plant cell. Provides **protection and support**.

**🧪 PLASTIDS**
Found in plant cells. Stores or synthesizes food.
*Ex:* Chloroplast (Photosynthesis).

**🗑️ LYSOSOME**
Contains hydrolytic enzymes. Known as the **Suicide Bag of the Cell**.

### **4. Genetics & Chromosomes**

**🧬 GENE**
Segment of **DNA** that determines a specific trait.

**👫 HUMAN**
**46** Chromosomes (23 pairs).

**🦟 MOSQUITO**
**6** Chromosomes (3 pairs).

**🥔 POTATO**
**48** Chromosomes (24 pairs).

### **5. Animal Tissues Overview**

**🧱 TISSUES**
Group of cells performing a specific function.

**🛡️ EPITHELIAL**
Covering/Lining tissue.

**🔗 CONNECTIVE**
Binding/Support tissue (e.g., Bone, Blood).

**💪 MUSCULAR**
Contractile tissue (Movement).

**🧠 NERVOUS**
Sensory tissue (Control/Coordination).

### **6. Evolution Theories**

**🦒 LAMARCKISM**
Theory of **Inheritance of Acquired Characters**.

**🌳 DARWINISM**
Theory of **Natural Selection**.

**🐛 MUTATION THEORY**
**Hugo de Vries** proposed evolution by sudden changes (mutations).

### **7. Classification Systems**

**5️⃣ FIVE KINGDOMS**
Proposed by **R. H. Whittaker** (Monera, Protista, Fungi, Plantae, Animalia).

**3️⃣ THREE DOMAINS**
Proposed by **Carl Woese** (Archaea, Bacteria, Eukaryota).

### **8. Virus & Subviral Agents**

**🦠 VIRUS**
Non-living entity outside host. Made of **Protein** and **Nucleic Acid** (DNA or RNA).

**🦠 BACTERIOPHAGE**
Virus that infects **Bacteria**.

**🧠 PRION**
Infectious agent made only of **Protein**.

**🌱 VIROID**
Infectious agent made only of **RNA**.

### **9. Human Body: Largest**

**🧪 GLAND**
**Liver** (Largest gland).

**🦴 BONE**
**Femur** (Longest bone).

**💪 MUSCLE**
**Gluteus Maximus** (Largest muscle).

**⚪ CELL**
**Neuron** (Longest cell).

### **10. Human Body: Smallest**

**🦴 BONE**
**Stapes** (Smallest bone in the ear).

**💪 MUSCLE**
**Stapedius** (Smallest muscle).

**⚪ WBC**
**Lymphocyte** (Smallest WBC).

**🔴 CELL**
**RBC** (Smallest cell).

### **11. Human Body: Other Facts**

**❤️ HEART BEAT**
**72** times per minute.

**💧 BLOOD VOLUME**
**5 to 6 litres**.

**🦴 BONE COUNT**
**206** in adults.

**🧠 ORGAN**
**Skin** (Largest Organ).

**💧 GLAND**
**Thyroid** (Largest Endocrine Gland).

### **12. Animal Kingdom Facts**

**🐘 MAMMAL**
*Largest:* **Blue Whale**.
*Smallest:* **Shrew**.

**🐦 BIRD**
*Largest:* **Ostrich**.
*Smallest:* **Hummingbird**.

**🐊 REPTILE**
**Crocodile** (Largest reptile).

### **13. Lifespan Facts**

**🐘 LONGEST**
**Tortoise** (Lifespan: 150 years).

**🐕 SHORTEST**
**Dog** (Lifespan: 16 years).

**🦋 INSECT**
**Mayfly** (Shortest lifespan: 1 day).

### **14. Venomous Animals**

**🐍 SEA SNAKE**
Most venomous snake in the world.

**🐍 COBRA**
Venom contains **Neurotoxins** (affects nerves).

**🐍 KRAIT**
Venom is fast-acting and highly lethal.

**🕷️ SPIDER**
**Black Widow** (Venomous spider).

### **15. Plant Kingdom Facts**

**🌳 LARGEST**
**Sequoia** (Largest plant).

**🌸 FLOWER**
*Largest:* **Rafflesia**.
*Smallest:* **Wolffia**.

**🧬 CROP**
**Triticum aestivum** (Wheat) is a **Hexaploid** plant.

### **16. Biotechnology: Transgenics**

**🐑 DOLLY**
First sheep created by **Cloning**.

**🧬 CLONING**
Production of an exact copy of a gene or an organism.

**🌱 BT-COTTON**
Genetically modified crop resistant to **pests**.

### **17. Biotechnology: Agriculture**

**🍚 GOLDEN RICE**
Genetically engineered to produce **Vitamin A**.

**🌾 HYBRID**
Offspring produced by the cross between **two distinct varieties**.

**🍚 COMPLETE FOOD**
**Milk** is considered a complete food for infants.

### **18. Bio-fertilizers**

**🦠 BACTERIA**
**Rhizobium** (for pulses) and **Azotobacter** (for cereals).

**🌿 ALGAE**
**Anabaena** and **Nostoc** (used in paddy fields).

**🌱 FUNCTION**
Increase fertility by fixing atmospheric **Nitrogen**.

### **19. Ecology & Environment Day**

**🌳 WORLD ENVIRONMENT DAY**
Observed on **5th June** every year.

**📚 ECOLOGY**
Study of the relationship between organisms and their environment.

### **20. Ozone Layer Depletion**

**🛡️ OZONE LAYER**
Absorbs harmful **UV rays** from the sun.

**💨 CAUSE**
Mainly destroyed by **Chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs)**.

**❄️ CFC SOURCE**
Mostly released from **Refrigerators** and **Air Conditioners**.

### **21. Historical Discoveries I**

**🔬 MICROSCOPE**
Discovered by **Janssen** (Simple) & **Leeuwenhoek** (Compound).

**🌡️ X-RAY**
Discovered by **Wilhelm Conrad Röntgen**.

**🧪 VITAMINS**
Discovered by **F. G. Hopkins** and named by **Funk**.

### **22. Historical Discoveries II**

**💉 VACCINATION**
Discovered by **Edward Jenner** (Smallpox).

**💊 PENICILLIN**
First antibiotic, discovered by **Alexander Fleming**.

**👂 STETHOSCOPE**
Discovered by **Rene Laennec**.
